pages.text: Duslia is a creature from the Ordovician of the Czech Republic and Morocco. Being one of the few examples of a non-trilobite member of the Artiopods, Duslia itself is fairly enigmatic, though currently being placed within Cheloniellida. It was fairly large, of a circular-shape, soft bodied, comprised of several body-segments, and was completely blind, lacking any eyes.

The only fossil evidence of potential sensory structures being preserved are hair-like protrusions that run alongside the outer edges of the body and segments, which may have been sensory (or perhaps defensive) organs, giving the creature a somewhat frilly look.
